665-31 WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND WHEN THE ENGINEER SPOTTED A BROKEN RAIL 1 CAR LENGTH AHEAD WEST RAIL. THE ENGINEER CAME OUT OF DYNAMICS AND WENT INTO FULL SERVICE TO PASS OVER THE BROKEN RAIL AND THETRAIN STARTED DERAILED, COMING TO A STOP 200 FEET FROM THE BROKEN RAIL.

REPAIRS TO THE ENGINES ARE NOT COMPLETED, ESTIMATED EQUIPMENT DAMAGE IS $75,000. TRACK DAMAGE UPDATED AND SUBMITTED WITH APRILS REPORTS.

0311PR017-d-03-17-11-UP.Narrative: WSOR'S CREW ON T003-17 DERAILED 9 CARS AT THE ANDERSON CONNECTION.  INVESTIGATION SHOWED THE TRACK WAS WITHIN STANDARDS.  IT APPEARS THERE WAS USE OF AIR BRAKES, INDEPENDENT BRAKE, AND TRAIN MAKE UP AT ORIGIN - TWO HEAVY LOADS AGAINST EMPTIES THAT CAUSED CAR TO JUMP RAIL.  DOWN LOAD ON ENGINES AND TRAIN CONSIST HAVE NOT BEEN PROVIDED.  BASED ON WHAT WE KNOW WE BELIEVE THIS IS A HUMAN FACTOR DERAILMENT.  WSOR'S ESTIMATED TRACK DAMAGE = $8677.88.  WSOR'S ESTIMATED EQUIPMENT DAMAGE = $6208.  UP ANDWSOR DID NOT AGREE ON CAUSE OF DERAILMENT.

0311UT010-d-03-10-11-UP.Narrative: YRO21R-10 WAS GATHERING UP CARS ON THE RUNNER.  FOREMAN WAS ON REAR OF THE YRO21R.  AT APPROXIMATELY1915, YRO21R-10 SIDESWIPED THE MNYRO-09 AS IT WAS ENTERING ROPER YARD FROM EAST END INTO TRACK 8.AFTER RECEIVING YARDING INSTRUCTIONS FROM YARDMASTER, CREW ON MNYRO-09 CONTACTED CREW ON THE YRO21R-10, REQUESTING PERMISSION TO ENTER ZONE 1 WHICH THE YRO21R-10 CLAIM THEY HAD ESTABLISHED AT 1700.  FOREMAN, WHO WAS WORKING DEEP IN TRACK 40 GAVE PERMISSION TO MNYRO TO ENTER ZONE 1 AND ENTER 8 RAIL.THE FOREMAN THEN PITCHED CONTROL TO HIS SW1 AND TOLD HIM TO GET ON THE POINT BECAUSE THERE WAS A TRAIN ENTERING THE ZONE AND THE 10 LEAD SWITCH WOULD BE AGAINST THEM.  FOREMAN CLAIMS TO HAVE HEARD ARESPONSE BUT WITH STATIC.  THE SW1 RECEIVED THE PITCH AND BEGAN TO PULL ABSENT FROM THE POINT CLAIMING HE NEVER KNEW THE ZONE WAS GIVEN AWAY.  YRO21R THEN SIDESWIPED MNYRO-09.  TRAIN SPEED OF THE YRO21R-10 WAS RECORDED AT 11 MPH.

INVESTIGATION REVEALED ENGINEER HAD UNCHARGEDBRAKE PIPE AND USED HEAVY INDEPENDENT TO MAKE STOP, RESULTING IN SLACK RUN-IN AND INITIAL DERAILMENT. NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE RELEASED.

000086488-d-03-08-11-CSX.Narrative: VEHICLE OPERATOR LOST CONTROL OF VEHICLE, WHILE ATTEMPTING TO NAVIGATE A TURN FROM THE I-95 OFF-RAMPAT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED, AND EXPERIENCED A SINGLE VEHICLE ACCIDENT WHICH LEFT THE VEHICLE DISABLEDAPPROXIMATELY 25 FEET SOUTH OF THE CROSSING. THE OPERATOR FLED THE SCENE IN ANOTHER VEHICLE. THE DISABLED VEHICLE WAS SUBSEQUENTLY STRUCK BY THE NORTHBOUND TRI-RAIL TRAIN P63808.

D08031711-d-03-17-11-FEC.Narrative: THE CROSSOVER SWITCH HAD A BROKEN PIN ALLOWING THE SWITCH SPINDLE TO DROP AND CAUSE A GAP IN THE SWITCH.  THIS RESULTED IN THE NORTH SET OF TRUCK ON LW 74417 TO GET BEHIND THE SWITCH POINT RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF ATW 8014, LW 74417, UTLX 66943 AND TILX 195046.  NO INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

0311TC006-d-03-09-11-UP.Narrative: MMCDM-09 MOVING AT APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH AFTER PASSING A RESTRICTED PROCEED SIGNAL INDICATION WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY DERAILING SIX CARS DUE TO BROKEN JOINT BARS.  RAIL = CWR

THE CONDUCTOR WALKED THE TRAIN AND FOUND 7 RAILCARS DERAILED AT THE REAR OFTHE TRAIN.  UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE A DEFECTIVE WHEEL.  RECOLLECTIBLE FROM PROGRESS RAIL.  RAIL = CWR
